page.title: 07Flower Festival, Hemingford
page.content:
Hemingford Abbots has always been a showplace by virtue of its historic and picturesque houses.
Since 1950 an additional feature for tourists has been the bi-annual Flower Festival. It take place in late June or early July with the intention of raising money for the local church, St Margarets. Many activies take place including church flower and festival services, open gardens, strawberry teas, bands, river trips, displays of historic cars and bicycles, organ recitals and folk dancing. Tickets are bought allowing visitors to tour some twelve open gardens and various displays on Saturday and Sunday between 2 and 8 pm. This years festival (1985) was a resounding success and raised in excess of Â£3,000.
